Process Types.name: proctype
Process Types.scenario: Used to define process types that specify the behavior of concurrent processes.

Global Variables.name: global variables
Global Variables.scenario: Used to define variables that can be accessed by multiple processes concurrently.

Local Variables.name: local variable declaration
Local Variables.scenario: Used to assign values to variables or update their values during process execution.

Statement Separators.name: semicolon and arrow
Statement Separators.scenario: Used to separate multiple statements in a process body. The arrow can indicate causality.

Process Instantiation.name: run statement
Process Instantiation.scenario: Used to create and execute instances of processes in the Promela model.

Macro Definitions.name: #define
Macro Definitions.example:
"
    #define true    1         // Define true as constant 1
    #define false   0         // Define false as constant 0
    #define Aturn   false     // Define Aturn as false
    #define Bturn   true      // Define Bturn as true
Macro Definitions.scenario: Used to define constant values or symbolic names in Promela specifications, similar to C-style macros.

Typedef Declaration.name: typedef construct
Typedef Declaration.scenario: Used to define custom data structures similar to structs in C, allowing the grouping of related variables under one type.

Inline Definition.name: inline construct
Inline Definition.scenario: Used to define reusable code blocks, similar to macros in C, helping to reduce repetition and improve code clarity.

Repetition and Nondeterministic Choice.name: do...od construct
Repetition and Nondeterministic Choice.scenario: Used to model repetition and nondeterministic choices among multiple guarded commands, continuing until a break is encountered or no guard is executable.

Loops with Conditionals.name: do...od loop with if...fi
Loops with Conditionals.scenario: Used to model repeated execution of code with internal branching using conditional guards, useful for iterative behavior with varying outcomes based on conditions.
